p: The inhibition zone diameters were measured according to the agar well diffusion method with marginal modification [ 19]. The essential oils and streptomycin (positive control) were separately dissolved in ethyl acetate (100 mg/mL) and distilled water solution (100 μg/mL). 100 μL of bacterial suspensions (10 6 CFU/mL) was evenly inoculated on the Mueller-Hinton agar plate. Then, filter paper discs of 6 mm diameter containing sample solution (20 μL) were added. After 24 h incubation at 37°C, the inhibition zone diameters were measured.
